meanings.definition: To give support, confidence, or hope to someone.
meanings.sent1: I always encourage my little sister when she feels scared.
meanings.sent2: Her teacher will encourage her to do her best on the test.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to encourage the kitten to play with a wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The warm sunshine seemed to encourage the flowers to bloom early.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk was so encouraging that the team felt ready to win.

meanings.definition: To inspire or motivate someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The success stories of others can encourage us to pursue our dreams.
meanings.sent2: His parents always encourage him to follow his passion for music.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to encourage the sleepy cat to join in the fun.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery can encourage artists to paint with passion.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd encouraged the runner to push through the finish line.

meanings.definition: To foster or promote a particular behavior or attitude.
meanings.sent1: Reading positive books can encourage a love for learning in children.
meanings.sent2: The company's policies aim to encourage teamwork among employees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to encourage the birds to join in its antics.
meanings.sent4: The gentle rain can encourage the plants to grow tall and strong.
meanings.sent5: The supportive community can encourage individuals to pursue their goals with confidence.
